about.title: About Me
about.description: My name is Francisco González Urriola, but my friends call me Pancho. I wrote my first lines of code in a robotics workshop using Python when I was 12. Since then, I've made steady progress and am now in my third year of the Computer Engineering program at the University of Chile.
about.description1: As part of my journey, I've been advancing in Software Engineering and Web Application Development, gaining the knowledge and tools needed to apply my skills in real-world projects. Below, you can find some of my work.

project1.title: DCCPlaces
project1.description: A platform for reserving spaces within the Department of Computer Science, developed as part of a team using Python and the Django framework. Currently, the repository is private.

project2.title: Rust Playground
project2.description: A web application that allows users to write, compile, and run Rust code in the browser, featuring basic examples. Built with React, Tailwind CSS, TypeScript and the Rust Playground API.

project3.title: Portfolio
project3.description: The portfolio you're currently viewing, featuring dark mode and multi-language support, built with React, Tailwind CSS and TypeScript.
